website_summaries.verdict: Tops our list for being a good looking and practical decoration set that complements almost any aquarium.
pros: Provides both attractive decor and stress-reducing fish hiding spots
Includes 8 pieces made of strong resin with a natural stone look
cons: Some of our testers noticed residue in the water, but this can be prevented by thoroughly rinsing the pieces before placing them in your aquarium

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: Zero stars. This is very rough/sharp. The outside is not so bad, but the inside is horrible. I'm not going to put in my tank with my kids fish. I was going to return it, but I'm very annoyed to find out that even though it is a prime item, that I just received, I can not return it. When I tried to return the rock it said that this product wasn't eligible for return. Frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Great for cichlids.  Just make sure fish aren't to big to get stuck.
customer_reviews.text: I have several African Cichlids from 4" to 7" The two larger sizes work great for this size fish. One of my 7" fish got stuck in the medium size and it took me forever to get him out. It tore him up really good as the inside is very rough and jagged. So I'm only using the 2 largest sizes. Love them though. I purchased 3 of these 8 piece sets for a 37 gallon aquarium. Plenty of hiding spots. I'm using the two smallest size stones in a different aquarium with smaller fish.
customer_reviews.author: Delta Kilo

customer_reviews.title: Steer clear of this one!
customer_reviews.text: Exceptionally rough. Bits and pieces fall off both while attempting to clean it and in the tank. The inside can quite easily damage delicate fins and/or scales. Additionally, it is so porous that algae are a real problem. If a piece a food happens to come to rest in the tunnel you can expect algae within a day or two. I would not only not recommend this, but I would advise you steer clear.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for reducing aggression in African cichlid communities.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this high-end set of rocks for my African cichlid freshwater tank last June and couldn't have been happier. I've since sold off my African cichlids and started a saltwater system, so now I use some of these rocks in my smaller freshwater puffer tank. My puffers love them too! That said, these are truly fantastic for minimizing aggression in an African cichlid community. Just be sure to divide up the line of sight as best you can, or they weren't function as separate territories as they're intended.
customer_reviews.author: MadisonTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Very nice but MUST BE sanded first
customer_reviews.text: Nice small overall size, yet has a big enough hole for a Betta or Goldfish. You MUST sand it inside and out before using as others have stated. Otherwise, it could tear up their fins. I bought the "68 Pieces 60 to 3000 Grit Sandpaper Assortment, 9 x 3.6 Inch, Dry/ Wet, Sandpaper for Wood Turning Finishing, Furniture Finishing, Automotive Sanding." I used the 60 grit to start and finished with the 240 grit. I spent about 30-45 mins on it.
customer_reviews.author: Annette L.

customer_reviews.title: Smelly and sharp
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a glue odor. I have been soaking them for 48 hours and running a charcoal filter in the bucket, still smells. The insides are incredibly rough, with many small sharp protrusions that will absolutely cut the fish. If they ever stop smelling, i will attempt to sand the insides. I will not put them in unless they can be smoothed. I ordered 2 sets of 8 for my 240 gal display tank. None arrived broken, but the big ones are in fact "big".
customer_reviews.author: BillMan

customer_reviews.title: Hideaway not for Betta Fish-TOO ROUGH
customer_reviews.text: Was disappointed in this. Wanted them (bought 2 one for each of my betta's) to put in tank with my betta. When I took it out it was rough, too rough for a betta as I am afraid it would hurt thier fins swimming through the opening. Also some of the finish or whatever came off in my hand which is really bad for my bettas. Might be ok for other fish whose fins are so delicated.
customer_reviews.author: ED Fan

customer_reviews.title: Not for betta. Shrimp loved it to death?
customer_reviews.text: My first issue is that this is not stone. It’s rather like compressed sand. It’s extremely rough. It looks ok in the tank. I rinsed it really well. My betta luckily is afraid of it. I was worried he might injury his fins. My shrimp really really like it. I still may need to remove to keep the betta away. I have no clue why it is suggested for any fish with long fins. Update: all my shrimp died the day after I put this product in my tank. I can’t say for sure it was because of this product although it is an established tank.you can decide for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really wanted to like this, but there is no quality control
customer_reviews.text: I ignored the other reviews and bought this anyway. It was poorly wrapped and the smaller piece was shattered in transit, even though box looked ok. The larger piece is the size I wanted, but it has jagged edges that are crumbly. Will need to sand it down so fish don't get cut up on it. It looks great in the photos and I really WANTED to like it, but the manufacture has poor quality control and no wrapping in shipping. With all the reviews saying this, you would think they would put some bubble wrap or paper in the box. There was nothing! Very disappointed. Sharp edges and broken. Should have believed the other reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha J Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Decent stone but pricey considering the need to smooth out inside area.
customer_reviews.text: I like the coloration and size of the stones for my African Cichlids tank. As others have pointed out, the interior of stone has very rough, “grainy” texture but the outside molding is smooth. Knowing this is for fish, I would think they would have sanded the inside where the fish will swim. I used a grinding wheel on my drill to smooth out as I was concerned on potential to injure a fish especially as they get large. Overall they are nice looking stones. I had issue of a broken shipment due to poor packaging when I bought a set of two. My first order of a single was fine.
customer_reviews.author: Greg S.

customer_reviews.title: Edges are very sharp - and look dirty after a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: Originally 4 stars - Set this up today in my 20 gallon tank. I like it but the edges are extremely sharp. I may need to file them down if I see my fish getting hurt. I attached a picture of them in my 20 gallon long. I need to do some rearranging but I like them. UPDATE: Decreased rating to 2 stars... It has been a few weeks and these have become discolored. There are large dark spots that I cannot clean off even with a brush. It just makes my tank look dirty.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Z

customer_reviews.title: Caution!!
customer_reviews.text: This hide-away set is a really cool idea, but the actual product is not so great. Like the other review says, this is a cheaply made item. The outside of the pieces are relatively smooth, but the rims of the openings and the inside is extremely jagged. I didn't buy this with my betta in mind, but I wouldn't put them in the same tank as my betta or any other fish with delicate fins or barbels. It may be good for short-finned fish or inverts, but use with caution.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Terrible purchase.
customer_reviews.text: So dang rough. Actually very sharp edges. Thought about taking my Dremel to it, but too risky bc concerned with fragments and dust. Terrible purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Steve H.

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp inside! Rough!
customer_reviews.text: The inside is insanely sharp and not okay for a Betta fish. I read everywhere to check all plastic plants and decorations because betas fins are easily caught and torn. The inside was soo rough. I eventually had to buy metal filers to file down the inside till it was okay for my Betta fish. Now he loves it. But that Little Rock became very expensive. Looks beautiful and was packaged nicely. But just be warned and be aware of the inside. VERY VERY SHARP
customer_reviews.author: Desire

customer_reviews.title: Very coarse inside
customer_reviews.text: This is a 30 gallon tall tank so the rocks are bigger than I thought which is nice but there are some thin spots you can see through if you hold them up to the light and they were so coarse on the inside it was equivalent to about 40 grit sandpaper so I also took a metal spoon to smooth the inside of all of them and then washed them all before I put them in my tank.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good and bad
customer_reviews.text: The good: looks good in the water, every one I've gotten for each betta uses it. Clean minimalist hide. The bad: It will always require a sanding before placing it in the water - there are usually sharp sand pieces that can be dangerous to bettas. It also gets a little dirty/discoloring after a few months and because it has a sandy texture, is impossible to wash out, it must be sanded off (or steel wool). still would get it though considering it's price and how it looks in the water. just needs adjustments
customer_reviews.author: CCB

customer_reviews.title: Like Sandpaper
customer_reviews.text: So when I read this was a "little" rough I thought it would be alright. It is NOT a "little" rough. The entire thing feels like sandpaper; outside and inside. Inside it is much more rough and less "smooth" and some spots are downright jagged. I honestly wouldn't use this for any type of aquarium due to the abrasive nature of the product. I can only imagine what trying to clean off any algae from this would end up like. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Wicked

customer_reviews.title: Good, for the price
customer_reviews.text: These are the prefect size for my beta tanks, but even after filing the sharp edges, hitting it with a coarse bristled brush, rinsing and soaking over night, they STILL cloud the water. It doesn’t seem to bother my fish, snails or plants, but it bugs me a little.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Moon

customer_reviews.title: Really cool and huge! Great cichlid hides
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars if 2 pieces weren’t broken. (Two of the caves were broken and unusable. They were one of the largest and a middle size.) I choose not to send all back but was somewhat disappointed.... :-( Otherwise the caves are Huge! I wasn’t expecting the large ones to be so big. The mediums are excellent size also. Makes sense as my cichlids grow they will still be able to use the med. & large sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Overall nice quality just larger then expected.
customer_reviews.text: These are much larger then expected. The largest cave is actually going to be used in one of my 80 gallon tanks. The large size is really to big to fit proportionately in anything smaller. One came smashed but it's not worth returning the whole bunch. They do have quite a strong smell so I'm going to wash them well before I put them in any of my tanks. Overall nice quality just larger then expected.
customer_reviews.author: Earth2Frog

customer_reviews.title: Too rough for my Betta?
customer_reviews.text: I like the size for my one Betta fish. The piece is VERY rough and am afraid it will tear the fins or tail of my guy. I’m afraid to put it in his bowl. I’ve tried smoothing it with a nail file but it doesn’t really smooth out like I want. I should have read the ad closer as I had thought it was made out of resin but instead a granite-like substance. I don’t trust it so I won’t use it.
customer_reviews.author: G-Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Ummm.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why but my fished just swim around it. I have a 10 gallons aquarium it seem to fit okay, but it gets dirty so fast, its very annoying. And very sharp on edges, so be ware.
customer_reviews.author: Vladimir S.

customer_reviews.title: Rough Interior and Sharp Openings!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely rough interior and openings, concerned it would harm fish. Very sharp opening edges.
customer_reviews.author: TStech

customer_reviews.title: One rock down - still a great deal
customer_reviews.text: One of the medium rocks arrived shattered but I didn’t want to go through the hassle of trying to swap for a new set not knowing if I would run into the same problem with the next box. These stackable hides were a perfect addition to replace PVC tubing pieces for my clown loaches. Fish are a lot more active in the tank and they look great! Some sand pieces came off as I manipulated the stack in my tank but easy to syphon out. Pictured in the corner of a standard 75 gallon (no substrate).
customer_reviews.author: Ronin

customer_reviews.title: Not Perfect, but Usable
customer_reviews.text: The larger of the two started to expel stuff into the water column, and was too large for my Fluval Flex 5gal tank. The small one is still in use, and went into my 3 gallon Marineland tank instead for my new fish after scrubbing it to clean out anything that might break off of it. They look great against a dark background, especially with dark browns and greens.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn LedgerTop Contributor: Japanese Food

customer_reviews.title: Same exact quality and product, 1/8th the price!
customer_reviews.text: This product was 99.9% exactly what you can buy from a LFS with the .01% being the cost. The $20 one I purchased from my LFS is the same size and one of the medium pieces that comes in this set. The material appears, feels and weighs the exact same as what the fish store sold me. I have a 55g and these are set up in a way that gives ample space for my fish. My only suggestion, get two sets of you really want to “fill” your tank out. See my photo - that is only one set! Fantastic buy, I will be purchasing many more!
customer_reviews.author: J. Lucas

customer_reviews.title: very rough
customer_reviews.text: Great weight and look, but the thing is very rough and gritty. I bought 3 one for each of my female Betta and one for the male. Make can't use it as it tears up his fins. Females seem ok as they are smaller with far less fin to worry about.
customer_reviews.author: D.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it! Excellent edition!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the bigger pack bc it seemed more sensible than buying several of the others. These rocks were worth every penny! I had one already that our large male loves but as we have been adding more African Cichlid females (Kenyi) we needed more hiding spaces. The eight piece set gave us that and more. I would recommend these rocks to everyone. We love them and so do the fish! We have a 55 gallon tank that’s 20 tall x 48 long x 12.5 wide if that helps you with sizing!
customer_reviews.author: Breanna

customer_reviews.title: Cichlid stone playground that makes them feel at home.
customer_reviews.text: Cichlids love these and will swim around exploring the new setup for a while. I agree that these have sharp areas that need to be sanded down prior to putting them in the tank. It took me also approx. 1 hour to get all the stones smooth enough not to harm the fish. I have also noticed that the fish are a lot less aggressive with these stones in the tank. I wish I had known about them sooner money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: J. Branche

customer_reviews.title: Great size for the price. Sharp on the inside but sandable.
customer_reviews.text: Nice size for the price. I think the fish will like it a lot. Has some sharp edges inside that I’ll have to sand down. I think it’s made out of molded and compressed sand. Some of it falls out when you first get it, and some of the sharp edges you can break off pretty easily with a knife. But otherwise I’m happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Tom

customer_reviews.title: Sour smell and not so smooth finish
customer_reviews.text: At first I had high expectation because of the rating on here. It didn’t end this way, there was a sour smell when I open the box. Still not sure if it was the packaging or the rocks itself. Had to soak the rocks in water for a day to get rid of the smell. Some of the bigger rocks’ opening were a rough I had to file it down to ensure my fish won’t hurt them selfies. Another thing is that two of the rocks seems like it’s about to break in half. Over all, not too happy about this purchase :/
customer_reviews.author: synic

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: My bristlenose pleco loves these caves! Honestly all my fish do. The Cory's hide in them too! In the morning when I turn on the light , some of my mollies and glow tetras are snoozing in there as well. Also , the caves give enough coverage and comfort along with my live plants to allow my pleco to feel safe enough for some daytime activity as well!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda hall

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 10 gallon planted!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two, but one came with the small stone broken in half. Very easy to return and was refunded quickly. The medium stone is the perfect size and both are exactly what I wanted for my natural/planted set up. Anything bigger than medium I feel would be too big. The rocks have a slightly bumpy, but not sharp, surface from the material they are made of. My 2 SAE love swimming through, resting in, and eating off of these. I ordered 2 more small ones and have been moving things around until I get everything exactly where I want it. I highly recommend these and will definitely get some more when I get another tank.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Awesome hideaways
customer_reviews.text: Happy that purchased them. It is much cheaper than buying in store and quality is the same. My fish love it. I have different fish and 2 parrot fish. Parrot fish are extremely territorial, so it's perfect to have so many hideaways. Will definitely buy more for other aquariums, and absolutely recommend this product. They are little bit sharp, but I have these for long time already and fish doesn't get hurt. I used sandpaper to make holes more smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Artem

customer_reviews.title: A must have for any tank!!!
customer_reviews.text: These rocks have been a great addition to my fish tank. My fish love to swim through and relax in them. Definitely would buy this product again if/when I decide to upgrade to a larger tank. The rocks are very sturdy and durable. They come individually wrapped to ensure they all come in one piece. The inside of the rocks are pretty rough, but it hasn't seemed to affect any of my fish. I've had these in my tank since August and have not seen any torn fins.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Fukushima

customer_reviews.title: Worrying me
customer_reviews.text: Looks good, but made water cloudy, one fish dead, then within 5 days major hairy algae growth. Never had this problem before. Maybe after they break-in, they will be okay. Update: after months of losing fish when I never had a problem of fish dying, I kept having fish die. Even tiger barbs and the EBJDs(5). I reminded these 'rock' and after a month no more fish dying. These are of course manmade and they must have used something that's toxic to fish. I recommend staying away.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Storck

customer_reviews.title: Rough and Worth It!
customer_reviews.text: Rough like others have said, but excellent quality for the money. I put these in with some cichlids and they loved them. Easily stackable. I use them in quarantine tanks when I’m not running copper and Jungle Bob’s caves go in my main displays.
customer_reviews.author: Clay E.

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: These rocks were shipped carefully; all arrived in one piece. These are a great value. Varying rock sizes are great. I put them all into a 29 gallon young African cichlid tank. As other reviews mention, they are a little rough around the holes. Might be a problem for fish bigger than mine, but so far so good, and my fish appreciate having their little territories from each rock. Very natural looking. Definitely recommend and would buy again if we got another cichlid tank, although they are certainly cool enough to put into a community style tank was well. The big rocks are nice caves and even the little ones make smaller fish feel safe.
customer_reviews.author: James K

customer_reviews.title: Stackable sand molded fish rooms
customer_reviews.text: Nice color, good structure and shape. It does provide 'rooms' in the aquarium for fish whose personality needs privacy, or a break in eye contact. The construction feels like molded sand. I haven't had any water quality issues with these structures. I am disappointed there are rough edges where the mold seams are. Fish owners who are concerned about soft fish mouths can easily file the rough edges down. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Momsense

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item thought it would look cool in my tank when I did get this product it was in pieces except one of them was still in tact. I know this item did not cost that much but it was poorly packaged and when I did get it from the delivery truck it sounded like 1,000 of pieces in a box.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Stanley

customer_reviews.title: My Bettas love these
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these for each of my male bettas and they both love these. They sit at the bottom of the tank and especially at night both of them retreat into their little caves. They definitely seem to feel more secure with this space to hide in provided in their tanks. The rocks are easy to clean and are a must have especially for bettas
customer_reviews.author: Lydia

customer_reviews.title: Trapped my turtle, thank god we noticed!
customer_reviews.text: We have a 20 year old Musk turtle. He was able to get in but couldn't get out. Thank goodness we noticed and were able to pull him and the rock out. We have now hollowed it out some more to avoid this happening again, but be wary if you have anything but fish in your tank.
customer_reviews.author: T. Carter

customer_reviews.title: My cichlids love these.
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 sets in my 125 gallon. Fish love them. They immediately seem at home. I love the look and style. Also when it comes to algea they are not easy to clean so I just flip them in the tank. Seems to kill the algae on the bottom. Mostly does the trick. Check out my reviews on YT Electric blue aquariums.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Fish tank highrise
customer_reviews.text: Love these ceramic fish habitats. Wonderful places for fish to hide. Many avenues to enter and leave. I have two tanks. A ten and a twenty. The one order was more than enough to set up both tanks. The ceramic habitats range from very small to medium and lastly large. They stack very nicely. I originally thought it was overpriced, but once I received it, I now think it was money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: T. Y. Green

customer_reviews.title: Excellent addition to my community  tank
customer_reviews.text: So far my fish are loving these stones. There are some fish that seem to hang out in the medium & large stones almost constantly The small stones don't appear to be popular with them, but I wasn't expecting much for those. They are a bit rough, but I didn't find any sharp edges on mine.
customer_reviews.author: R. Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Rough interior!!! BUT...
customer_reviews.text: UPATE: I decided to grind down the roughness with my Dremel. It worked great! It is extremely rough on the inside. I will sand off the sharpest parts and line it will aquarium silicone. I’ll try to update it afterward and let everyone know if my betta likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Dixie

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: It is smooth outside, and a little rough on the inside so i chose to go with the larger stone so it's more of like a giant cave for my betta. It looks beautiful in my tank. I have a 5gallon cylinder tank so it is kind of big i had to tilt it on its side but i like the look. The holes are large enough for betta to swim through so it doesnt hurt his fins.
customer_reviews.author: shelly lapointe

customer_reviews.title: My Swim Family Loves this little cave
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased this cozy little cave for my half moon betta, but my amano shrimp and his cute little African Dwarf frog brothers have been hanging out in here. The Mystery Snails enjoy climbing on top of it too. It is the perfect size for all my little aquatic family and I'm glad that I made the purchase. I thoroughly enjoy seeing them using this cave. The shrimp likes to hang upside down inside of it which is pretty cool to see.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: My beta fish loves this
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to put in my small 1.5 gallon beta tank. My Fish loves this. I washed it with water and put it in the tank. He immediately swam to it and then went inside and back out. He then went inside and stayed inside for a little while. It feels just like stone. There are no jagged edges and it fits perfectly in my small tank.
customer_reviews.author: honey81

customer_reviews.title: Great for territorial fish
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to other reviewers, I knew I’d need to sand down rough areas and soak the rocks prior to using. It’s time consuming, but the result is safer for the fish and wasn’t difficult. I love the look of the rocks in our 40 gallon breeder tank, and our Betta sorority loves playing in them. They add a lot of interest and function for territorial fish.
customer_reviews.author: SarahWV

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely AMAZING! I bought these not really realizing just how BIG they are. But I managed to fit a couple in my small 5.5 tank. With these becareful because they are sharp and a little rough and I would suggest filing them a bit. But other then that they are amazing. But I'd definitely be getting a bigger tank to fit the rest.
customer_reviews.author: Shantarica

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR BETTA FISH!
customer_reviews.text: This little stone is very nice and attractive and would have been a great addition to my betta tank but it is REALLY ROUGH and not suitable for bettas. The inside of the stone would surely rip a fragile betta fin. If you have other fish who this is suitable for, by all means, buy it. It is a nice size and really cute--but not for a betta.
customer_reviews.author: B.

customer_reviews.title: Decent overall product
customer_reviews.text: The rocks are a bit rugged but my cichlids like hiding in them especially at night. They stack nicely but some do not have flat bottoms making them not sit flat on top of each other. After a few months they get algae on them and darken up nicely making them look natural. Overall decent product and great hiding places for my fish. Would recommend soaking them overnight in water as they may cloud the water in your fish tank.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Well all the bad things people said in the reviews it's the truth the whole truth and nothing but the truth. Cheaply made, very rough and sharp edges. They are not cheap but they are cheaply made. I would never put that in my tank not to mention they arrived damaged and they smelled bad as well. I just keep looking for something else. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Blanca Mills

customer_reviews.title: Fish was injured
customer_reviews.text: My fish loved this rock but it's very rough edged. He stayed in the rock constantly but ended up getting a sore on his back from entering and leaving the rock. I had to take out of the tank. I wouldn't recommend this for people's fish.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Billups

customer_reviews.title: Good for cichlids
customer_reviews.text: My cichlids love this! My alpha Male has made this his home territory. Unpackage it outside as there will be some loose sediment the box. I did not need to sand it down as others mentioned in their reviews but my fish are used to real rock in the tank so this rock is nothing different for them.
customer_reviews.author: JPed

customer_reviews.title: Too big, too rough.
customer_reviews.text: It is way bigger than you think! Not sure why but the measurements are misleading. It's very rough too so do not use with bettas! It would be perfect if smoother and smaller. Would work in a large tank with fish that arent delicate.
customer_reviews.author: Jones

customer_reviews.title: A favorite in the small temp tank
customer_reviews.text: While he was in the temp tank as I was cycling the permanent tank, my betta really loved this thing. He didn't have much tank decor- a plant and this. Now in the big tank with lots of plants and rocks he ignored it so I took it out. But if you need to keep a small tank that will have nowhere else to hide, this is a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: I love these BUT...(dead fish warning)
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these for quite a while. I have a 60 gallon with about 7 larger cichlids in there. Nothing huge but bigger fish. Unfortunately, I woke up this morning and one was dead and stuck in a hole of one of the second to smallest rocks. 😭 Needless to say, I tossed those two sized rocks and will leave the others as the tiny ones are for looks and the two larger ones have holes big enough. Just sucks. Gonna miss that little guy. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Skrilla513

customer_reviews.title: Edges and inside are VERY rough
customer_reviews.text: The one I saw in the store wasn't as rough as this, but it will DEFINITELY tear the fins of a betta. I had to file it down on the openings and inside base with a file. Looks cool, but not as smooth as I had expected.
customer_reviews.author: jessica p

customer_reviews.title: Do What's Right for Your Critter...Avoid This.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this a shot for one of my baby axolotls who was too small to go in the large tank. Crumbles. Doesn't feel nice. Not easy to sand down or do anything with...I ended up throwing them away. They were pretty crappy.
customer_reviews.author: BiologyNerd

customer_reviews.title: Some of the pieces in the set are HUGE!
customer_reviews.text: Do not be like me and not read the sizing of each piece. I was expecting much smaller pieces because I just looked at the picture and made an assumption on the sizI got. My plan was to use all of the pieces in both of my 20 gallon aquariums. I was only able to use the smallest pieces but I’m still happy because now my ghost shrimp, loaches and algae eaters have more places to hide and their hiding places are not ugly.
customer_reviews.author: LLB

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Work Out
customer_reviews.text: The scratchiness of the material made it difficult to clean because any sponge or cloth to it would get ruined or pieces of the sponge would get caught on the hideaway pieces. Further, the lighter color showed any algae/scum that it collected very easily. I didn't like the look of the tank or hassle of cleaning it, so I tossed mine out.
customer_reviews.author: E. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great value. Feels like real stone. Heavy.
customer_reviews.text: I payed so much more for this product at petco. This product is such a better deal, it even has more weight to it. Feels like actual stone. Had to do some light sanding on the inside just to be safe. For the price I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Jack McCoy

customer_reviews.title: Good value for price, rinse well
customer_reviews.text: I am giving three stars because the inside is very ruff. Also very strong chemical smell. I ran them through the dishwasher on rinse seven times, then put them in my empty tank. I waited a week before adding fish and had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Cichlids LOVE these
customer_reviews.text: My Cichlids LOVE these. Its fun watching them swim in and out of the stones. These arrived individually wrapped in bubblewrap with no breakage. As another reviewer noted, there was an odor to them but that cleared after I soaked and cleaned them. There are rough edges and peaks on the interior. I solved this by scraping/rubbing with a teaspoon and using a toothbrush to clean away debris.
customer_reviews.author: Savvy VA Shopper

customer_reviews.title: African Dwarf frog hideout. Buy sand paper!!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely sharp on the inside when you receive it. If you don't already have any, be sure to add (wet or dry) sand paper to your cart. Besides it being super rigid,15 minutes of sanding the inside and out and it's absolutely beautiful! I only used the smaller piece because my tank is under 5 gallons and the larger piece would have just over taken it. Definitely glad I purchased to give my little dwarf frogs a hideout.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must have for cichlids
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! Well packaged and high quality. Must have for cichlids. I’ve notice a decrease in aggressive behaviors. Plus it’s fun seeing them weaving in and out of all the rocks all day, I can tell they love them. I have a 55 gal and I might buy a second set. The large rocks are HUGE- way bigger than I expected. A full grown Oscar can fit inside easily. Pricey up front but worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Cracked
customer_reviews.text: This is the second set of these I have purchased. First set I was impressed with. This second set is poorly crafted. The seam area is cracked on at least three rocks, one rock has so much product on the inside it look like a spill took place in the molding of these things...or however they are made. My first set no odor was noticed...this second set an odor is still present after soaking and rinsing. The two stars are mainly for the cracks in the rocks...I wonder how long they will last.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: These rocks are sharp but easy to smooth with a hand file
customer_reviews.text: These rocks are sharp but easy to smooth with a hand file! The material is soft (like dried play dough mixed with sand) and can be filed back so sharp edges become smooth in no time. I was even able to use the hand file to expand some of the smaller holes to make them bigger. I found this product in combination with two () nicely filled my 20 gallon high African cichlid tank.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Harden

customer_reviews.title: Disgusting!!!!
customer_reviews.text: When received the inside of the box smelled strongly like urine and the rock was crushed in lots of pieces! The smell was horrendous !!! Closed box, washed hands and sent back!
customer_reviews.author: Rayrayahunt

customer_reviews.title: I do also recommend using sandpaper to smooth out the edges and inside ...
customer_reviews.text: My betta loves this! I do also recommend using sandpaper to smooth out the edges and inside if you are able. They catch onto it rather quickly and my betta was hiding in ththe rocks the same day I placed it in his tank.
customer_reviews.author: S. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Rough
customer_reviews.text: This is too large, my fault for not measuring! The reason for 2 stars is it has very sharp edges that would need to be sanded. I can’t use it and forgot to send it back, so now I’m stuck with a garden rock thing. :)
customer_reviews.author: EZShoping

customer_reviews.title: Great for making varying size caves
customer_reviews.text: Honestly these things look great. The appear to be constructed using fused sand so they have a rough texture. All 8 pieces can easily fill a 55 gallon with randomly placed caves and they barely fit into a 29 gallon. Overall, this product is one of the more cost effective options when buying commercial caved for an aquarium. Also, I saw bad reviews regarding the packaging but my stones were all individually wrapped in bubble wrap and they seemed almost impossible to break while in the package.
customer_reviews.author: steven joyce

customer_reviews.title: Goldfish Love These Caves!
customer_reviews.text: My two Goldfish LOVE hanging out in the extra-large cave!!! I had to buy another kit so both of them had their own place! My two are getting larger so I need a bigger size, but for now they give the fish a feeling of safety and privacy that I didn't know goldfish needed...they do! Great product!!
customer_reviews.author: A. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Look nice but clean and soak well and file edges
customer_reviews.text: These are made of a sandy fiberglass/glue like material. It smells like fiberglass and easily crumbles. I soaked them in water for a week before use. The water was very cloudy. I also used a file to smooth the sharp edges to keep the fish safe. Then they were fine to use. They look great.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Small Fish Like It
customer_reviews.text: Well my Betta could care less about this rock, he prefers to hang in the plants, but...the danios love to swim through it all the time. This is why I gave it 5 stars. They seem to enjoy swimming though it, like it is some sort of toy and adventurous path. I would guess all small fish would probably like this rock.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Miller

customer_reviews.title: Large rocks and decently heavy
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty well made and have some good weight to them. The set is nice and looks great in the tank. Also a great price compared to what I was finding elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: William A.

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR BETTA FISH
customer_reviews.text: This is smaller than expected, which is fine, but it is EXTREMELY ROUGH. I've seen a few reviews saying that sanding it down will work, but honestly I'm not even sure that will cut it for the 'cave' I got. It is rough all over the inside, the holes, and the outside. I can't return it, but am going to try sanding it so I can still use it. Will update.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney Mara

customer_reviews.title: It's Okay.
customer_reviews.text: I really want to like this product (Small stone hideaway rock). It's a good price and the package arrived on time. However, I found it wasn't suitable "as is" for my betta tank because it's so rough on the inside. This was easily fixed by sanding it down a bit. The bigger concern is that it slightly raised the pH in my tank (5-gallon). This might not be a problem for bigger tanks, though.
customer_reviews.author: dxs

customer_reviews.title: Good for a Small Fish
customer_reviews.text: This piece looks nice in the tank but it is pretty small. I had to sand it down as the edges were very rough. My betta is probably too big for this piece. I haven't seen him go into it yet. Eh for the price, it's OK.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Nocella

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price $3.99 for large ones
customer_reviews.text: Snagged these on sale no way to complain the make tank look great. Only issue I'd say at all is the seem is really noticable so they do still have a fake look to them.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Brown

customer_reviews.title: My betta likes it.
customer_reviews.text: I sometimes find my Betta "chilling" inside this stone so I ended up buying the bigger size of this rock hideout. He sleeps there at night now. When he is sleeping half of his body is inside the rock with his face sticking out and looking up , it is most adorable.
customer_reviews.author: OvO

customer_reviews.title: Kind of upset
customer_reviews.text: I love the sizes of the stones however one came broken and I'm sure it wasnt the seller faults but I wish they would have all came intact for the price I paid (there was no FRAGILE written on the box). I also didn't realize how sharp the edges were on the stone so it did cut a few fins on my fishes so I had to take them out. It's in storage now and I've only had it for less than a week.
customer_reviews.author: Rena

customer_reviews.title: Minimalistic! Perfect for my aesthetic
customer_reviews.text: Thin and rough. I had to wet sand it for my betta but it turned out great and smooth after. Please make sure for the not tough skinned fish you sand it a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Fish love it
customer_reviews.text: I love it , and my betta fish does too , he’s only in there hardly coming out in case someone else would come in . I got the smallest package and the medium is pretty big so I’m glad I did not get the large one 🙈 Looks great in my small aquarium !
customer_reviews.author: Suzanna Slobodean

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: My cichlids love these, and they have significantly helped curb aggression in my small tank. I have a large and very aggressive maingano male and he’s leaving all my others alone. There’s also a good assortment of sizes. My only critique is the rough edges.
customer_reviews.author: LBA

customer_reviews.title: Good little hidey hole
customer_reviews.text: My small cichlids (~1.5") love the larger of these. The small one they can fit into but they avoid it because it's slightly too small. The smaller one would work for small creatures like shrimps and neon tetras. A little too rough if you're looking to use it for delicate species like betas.
customer_reviews.author: Bran

customer_reviews.title: Happy but they dropped the cost shortly after I got it
customer_reviews.text: I am pretty happy with these and the fish seem to really like it however I was shocked when I looked at it two weeks or so later and the price was about 1/2 what I paid for it!!!! At the new price it is a great deal for your African Cichlids!
customer_reviews.author: Michael J.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value cichlids luv it!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe the size of these! Theyre great!! These are $50 at a local pet store. Will buy more. After 1 minute of putting these in the tank my parrot was already in it exploring!
customer_reviews.author: charlene hermance

customer_reviews.title: Needs a little work
customer_reviews.text: As others have reviewed the edges are a little sharp. Took a file and a drimmel tool to smooth them out and they work fine. Get them on sale and it is worth the extra work not to pay 22$ from the local pet store
customer_reviews.author: Dan Morgan

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome
customer_reviews.text: Love these! I placed them in my snakes cage and she loves exploring and going in and out of the different pieces. They are a great size.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Makes many new cichlid homes!
customer_reviews.text: Large assortment of "caves". Arrived very nicely packaged and nothing was broken. They stack nicely and look good. The only thing i could ding them on is the insides are a little like sandpaper.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The inside of this rock is too rough for a ...
customer_reviews.text: The inside of this rock is too rough for a Betta. Its fins would likely get damaged. We didn’t even try to put it in the tank.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Ott

customer_reviews.title: My danios and juvenile angels even like this. My bolivian ram stayed there a bit ...
customer_reviews.text: My danios and juvenile angels even like this. My bolivian ram stayed there a bit in the beginning - i think he felt safe in it. The angels barely fit in, but one still likes to hang out there sometimes. I have a cave also, but some like this more with the several openings. One of my clown plecos likes to hangout sort of underneath on the lower side of it. Good addition and price for my community aquarium.
customer_reviews.author: jere54

customer_reviews.title: Love these.
customer_reviews.text: These rocks are great. In an actual store they cost twice this amount for the same amount of rocks. Our cichlids love them. They smelled like vinegar when they arrived, but with a rinse they were fine. They have been in the tank several months now with no issue and the fish hang out in them constantly.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Howland

customer_reviews.title: ... wary of purchasing these because of the feedback of poor packing and broken pieces
customer_reviews.text: I was wary of purchasing these because of the feedback of poor packing and broken pieces. My order was well packed, each piece in generous bubble wrap, and in a compartment box. they arrived whole and in tact. They are bigger than I expected, which is welcome as my cichlids grow. They are, as others have mentioned, *imitation* stone ("stonelike") - superheated sand particles. They look good, though.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Nice little hide out
customer_reviews.text: Great little hide out for my betta fish. Inside area is a very rough surface so isn’t that easy to get clean but it’s beautiful
customer_reviews.author: tljenkins27

customer_reviews.title: Good Hideaways
customer_reviews.text: Bought this so that the platys in my 10 gallon tank could have places to "get away". I've noticed they like to sleep in them at night, like having a bedroom. Bonus function: They also use the top of them for toilet paper. ...They seem quite effective in that area.
customer_reviews.author: Nate Hendricks

customer_reviews.title: Ph increased after  introducing this product to my tank .
customer_reviews.text: Very large, they can overcrowds even a large tank, I have a 38 gallon and this was a bit too much. Also my pH skyrocketed off the test charts after putting these in my tank. I would try the two piece kit before buying this larger one. I no longer use these at all .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Penn-Plax Deco-Replicas Granite Aquarium Ornament Series – Realistic Stone Appearance – Safe for Freshwater and Saltwater Tanks – Great for Territorial Fish
product_meta.description: Size:Small, Medium, and Large (8 Piece Set)Deco-Replicas presents the Granite Aquarium Ornament & Hideaway 8 Piece Set (Small, Medium, and Large) by Penn-Plax. Although these items are not made from granite, they resemble the real thing. Not only does these pieces compliment the interior décor of many modern homes, they also serve as hideaways and swim-throughs for your fish. Perfect for cichlid tanks, since they’re territorial fish, and must create their own space. Easily Stackable: Our granite-like ornaments come in different sizes; this 8 piece set includes 3 Small, 3 Medium, and 2 Large. Stack or arrange these stones however you’d like within your tank. The possibilities and combinations are endless! Super Simple to Clean: Simply wipe down and rinse off ornament with warm water when you are cleaning out your tank. Never use soap, as the residual soap particles can harm your fish. It’s safe for both freshwater and saltwater aquariums. Measurements: Small (2” x 2. 75” x 2. 5”); Medium (3” x 5” x 4. 75”); Large (3. 5” x 6” x 5. 5”). Shop Penn-Plax for All Your Pet’s Needs: Penn-Plax is a manufacturer and distributer of top quality pet supplies, who specialize in creating excellent pet products for animals, both great and small.
feature_bullets: REALISTIC APPEARANCE: This Deco-Replicas Stone Aquarium Ornament & Hideaway 8 Piece Set resembles natural granite. Not only do these pieces compliment the interior décor of many modern homes, they also serves as hideaways and swim-throughs for your fish. Perfect for cichlid tanks, since they’re territorial fish, and must create their own space.

EASILY STACKABLE: Our granite-like ornaments come in different sizes; this 8 piece set includes 3 Small, 3 Medium, and 2 Large. Stack or arrange these stones however you’d like within your tank. The possibilities and combinations are endless!

SUPER SIMPLE TO CLEAN: Simply wipe down and rinse off ornament with warm water when you are cleaning out your tank. Never use soap, as the residual soap particles can harm your fish. It’s safe for both freshwater and saltwater aquariums.
MEASUREMENTS: Small (2” x 2. 75” x 2. 5”); Medium (3” x 5” x 4. 75”); Large (3. 5” x 6” x 5. 5”)
SHOP PENN-PLAX FOR ALL YOUR PET’S NEEDS: Penn-Plax is a manufacturer and distributer of top quality pet supplies, who specialize in creating excellent pet products for animals, both great and small.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
